definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: Philology prevailed very much in Qing Dynasty and especially many top-ranking scholars ever studied it at that time.
sentences.chinese: 清代小學極其昌盛，第一流的學者對小學均多所研究。

sentences.english: England under George II was prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 喬治二世統治下的英國繁榮昌盛。

sentences.english: Their citizens individually have been happy and the nation prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 公民們個個幸福歡樂，國家昌盛發達。

sentences.english: Thank you for contribution to China’s flourishing and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您爲祖國的繁榮昌盛做出的貢獻。

sentences.english: Rising prosperity alone will not placate people indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅是繁榮昌盛不足以無限期地安撫民衆。

sentences.english: Our country is thriving and prospering day by day.
Singing the prosperity of the motherland.
Therefore, putting the "Fu" character up side down is used as a metaphor, showing the arrival of promising spring and auspicious prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 因此，倒貼的“福”字象徵着春天和繁榮昌盛的到來。

sentences.english: Our motherlands certainly prosper the prosperous more.
sentences.chinese: 我們的祖國一定會更加的繁榮昌盛的。

sentences.english: Hong Kong's economy has boomed on the back of breakneck economic growth in Mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 大陸經濟的強勁增長也帶動了香港經濟的繁榮昌盛。

sentences.english: I strongly believe that Hong Kong people love their country and want to see it prosper.
sentences.chinese: 我堅信，香港人都熱愛祖國，希望國家昌盛富強。
他們延續的時間要遠遠超過底特律昌盛的時日。

sentences.english: The horse will not bring you happiness and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 那馬不會給你們帶來幸福和昌盛。

sentences.english: The British Empire flourished in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 英帝國在19世紀曾昌盛一時。

sentences.english: Our country is thriving and prospering day by day.
sentences.chinese: 喬治二世統治下的英國繁榮昌盛。

sentences.english: I hope that the country prospers and the people are at peace.
sentences.chinese: 我希望國家繁榮昌盛，人民安居樂業。

definition: the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
a flourishing period/period of prosperity/a golden age
efficient government, people at peace (idiom); all is well with the state and the people
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
